docs.lead_paragraph: The Stella D’oro bakery in Kingsbridge is scheduled to close within the next week or so, costing 155 jobs and ending a business started in 1932 that had a devoted following.

headline.seo: Last Batch at Stella D’oro Bakery in the Bronx
headline.main: A Last Batch at a Bakery in the Bronx

headline.main: A Nation at Odds Over Health Care
headline.print_headline: A Nation at Odds Over Health Care

docs.lead_paragraph: As Capitol Hill froths with controversy over the cost of a health care overhaul, many readers posting comments on Health Care Conversations, The New York Times's new online forum, have been discussing a sensitive subset of that topic: what should be done to improve, and to pay for, care at the end of life. ''At what point should we stop trying to prevent the inevitable? Is keeping someone alive for three more days worth the pain and suffering?'' wrote Jeff, a poster from Wyoming. ''This is a complex issue to be sure, and unfortunately one that is going to get overlooked due to partisan bickering and name-calling.''
docs.abstract: Readers' comments from online forum Health Care Conversations in response to topic of what measures should be taken to improve, and to pay for, care at end of life; drawing (S)
docs.snippet: As Capitol Hill froths with controversy over the cost of a health care overhaul, many readers posting comments on Health Care Conversations, The New York Times's new online forum, have been discussing a sensitive subset of that topic: what should be...

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate Finance Committee still intends to vote this week on its health care bill, possibly as soon as Thursday. But the panel's 10 Republicans want to have some budget and tax experts weigh in first. In a letter on Tuesday to the committee's chairman, Max Baucus, Democrat of Montana, the Republicans demanded that officials from the Congressional Budget Office and the Joint Committee on Taxation be brought before the panel to answer any questions ahead of any changes or a final vote on the health care bill.
docs.abstract: Senate Finance Committee will still vote on health care bill but panel's 10 Republicans are requesting officials from Congressional Budget Office and Joint Committee on Taxation be brought in to answer questions ahead of any changes or final vote; committee Chmn Max Baucus had already arranged for experts to sit in (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The White House has landed another big Republican voice in support of a health care overhaul: Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger of California. With health care legislation headed for debate on the floors of both chambers of Congress, the Obama administration has increased efforts to win support from Republicans away from Capitol Hill, where Republican lawmakers are overwhelmingly opposed to the legislation.
docs.abstract: California Gov Arnold Schwarzenegger says he favors health care overhaul; Obama administration has increased efforts to win support from Republicans away from Capitol Hill, where Republican lawmakers are overwhelming opposed to legislation; other prominent Republicans who express support of bill noted; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: The doctor's office seems to be one of the last places not yet transformed by Web technology, but a handful of tech start-ups are trying to change that.

headline.main: Start-Ups Aim to Transform Visits to the Doctor

docs.abstract: A handful of tech start-ups use the Web to make it easier for doctors and patients to interact.
docs.snippet: A handful of tech start-ups use the Web to make it easier for doctors and patients to interact.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Democrats introduced legislation on Tuesday to make it easier for older workers to win age discrimination lawsuits (a Supreme Court decision in June had made it harder by requiring that the worker show that age was the deciding factor in an employment decision).
docs.abstract: Has age discrimination on the job become a bigger problem?
docs.snippet: Has age discrimination on the job become a bigger problem?

docs.lead_paragraph: Don't mourn the public option in the Senate. It's not dead yet.

headline.main: Senator Ben Nelson, Democrat, Warms to a 'Public Option' Compromise

docs.abstract: A Democratic opponent of a "public option" for health insurance, Senator Ben Nelson, expresses interest in a compromise proposal by another Democrat, Senator Thomas R. Carper.
docs.snippet: A Democratic opponent of a "public option" for health insurance, Senator Ben Nelson, expresses interest in a compromise proposal by another Democrat, Senator Thomas R. Carper.

docs.lead_paragraph: Long before Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger of California expressed support on Tuesday for President Obama's effort to extend health coverage to all Americans, Mr. Schwarzenegger had his own plan to extend coverage to all Californians.

headline.main: Schwarzenegger's Support for a Health Care Overhaul Has Roots in a California Effort

docs.abstract: Long before Governor Schwarzenegger expressed support for Obama's health care effort, he had his own plan to extend coverage to all Californians.
